result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:48 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane. Defendant Arthur D Hudson appeared by Zoom video, in custody at Racine Correctional.  Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse in court for Arthur D Hudson.  Atty. Sonderhouse provides an update; he is still in a posture to resolve the matter but needs more time to have the plea questionnaire completed.  Atty. Sonderhouse requests a new plea and sentencing date in about 30 days.  No objection by the State.  Court will adjourn for plea and sentencing.  Defendant to appear by Zoom video from RCI for the next court date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Plea/sentencing hearing on August 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:34 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Arthur D Hudson in court by Zoom video means, in custody at DCI, with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Reider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Atty. Sonderhouse provides an update, he has an offer but needs to review it with his client.  Atty. Sonderhouse is requesting a projected plea and sentencing date at the end of August or erly October.  Defendant to appear by Zoom video from DCI for the next court date, noting that if video is not available the matter may need to be rescheduled to another date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Hearing on August 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.

08:44 AM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing.  Defendant Arthur D Hudson in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Nikole Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes the matter is before the Court to address Defendant's request for bail reduction filed on 6/8/22.  Court inquires if based on the sentence imposed in 19CF449 Atty. Sonderhouse would still like to address bail.  Atty. Sonderhouse advises that he will withdraw the request to modify bail at this time and requests a further proceedings date.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  If the defendant is transferred to another facility by the next court date the Court will have the defendant appear by video from that facility.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Check Case scheduled for July 8, 2022.
Waukesha County Jail  Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 6/6/22. Defendant requesting a bail reduction.
Hearing on June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:43 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Arthur D Hudson in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Nikole Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court will continue to tag this matter along with 19CF449 for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:40 AM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing.  Defendant Arthur D Hudson in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes defense filed a bail motion to be addressed today.  Atty. Sonderhouse presents arguments and is requesting to have the cash bail amount lowered.  State objects and presents arguments.  Atty. Sonderhouse presents additional statements.  Court places its findings on the record.  For reasons placed on the record the Court denies the motion to modify bail; bail to remain as previously set.  Court will maintain the previously scheduled hearing set for 06/06/2022 at 8:30 a.m.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:52 AM Defendant Arthur D Hudson in court, in custody, with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  City of Menomonee Falls Police Officer Vincent Strome sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Wittchow.  Cross examination by Attorney Sonderhouse.  State rests.  State moves for bind over without argument.  Attorney Sonderhouse objects to bind over and moves for dismissal.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.    Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision, the Court downgrades the WCS level from 4 to 2.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.  The Defendant to report to WCS within 1 business day from being released.
